event.title: led to the diverse population of the town today

data.event: Over time it attracted people from the surrounding areas, which led to the diverse population of the town today.

event.title: October 19, 1904, El Cayo was officially declared

data.event: On October 19, 1904, El Cayo was officially declared a town by the government of British Honduras.
In the past a creek ran between the Macal and the Mopan rivers one mile outside of San Ignacio going toward Benque Viejo.

event.title: the late 1940s, but since the creek eventually dried up

data.event: There was a large wooden bridge across this creek in the late 1940s, but since the creek eventually dried up, the area was filled with limestone gravel and today there remains no evidence of its existence.

event.title: was filled with limestone gravel and today

data.event: There was a large wooden bridge across this creek in the late 1940s, but since the creek eventually dried up, the area was filled with limestone gravel and today there remains no evidence of its existence.
